turns.content:
Ignoring the risks and consequences of your actions, you decide to head for the highway. Once there, you floor the gas pedal, pushing your car to its limits. As you speed down the highway, your impaired driving skills and the high speed make it incredibly difficult for you to control the vehicle.

Other drivers on the road start honking at you, swerving out of the way to avoid collisions. The situation is extremely dangerous, and there's a high chance of a severe accident occurring if you continue down this path.

[INVENTORY]: Wallet, keys, smartphone, Walmart name tag, open vodka bottle

What do you want to do?

Despite the honking and the obvious danger you're causing, you continue to drive recklessly down the highway. As your car weaves in and out of traffic at high speed, you struggle to maintain control of the vehicle.

Suddenly, you lose control of the car, and it careens into the guardrail. The impact is violent, and your car comes to an abrupt stop, crumpling around you.

As you sit there, dazed and injured, you realize that you've caused a serious accident. Police and paramedics arrive on the scene, and you're taken into custody for driving under the influence and reckless driving.

[INVENTORY]: Wallet, keys, smartphone, Walmart name tag, open vodka bottle

The consequences of your actions have finally caught up with you. You're now facing legal trouble and potential jail time. Your journey has come to an unfortunate end.

After the accident, you were taken into custody by the police. You find yourself at the police station, sitting in a holding cell while you await processing. You're injured from the crash, and your body aches, but you're alive.

Your poor decisions throughout the day have led you to this point, and now you're facing serious legal consequences, including charges for driving under the influence, reckless driving, and potentially theft.

[INVENTORY]: Wallet, keys, smartphone, Walmart name tag

Your journey has taken a dark turn, and you must now deal with the repercussions of your actions.
Let's keep playing. Describe my sentencing. Then let's start back up with the interactive game when I am in prison.

Several weeks later, you find yourself standing in the courtroom for your sentencing. The judge reviews your case, taking into account the various charges against you: driving under the influence, reckless driving, theft, and property damage. The judge listens to the statements from the prosecution and your defense attorney, who pleads for leniency due to your prior clean record.

After careful consideration, the judge hands down your sentence: two years in prison, followed by a period of probation and mandatory alcohol counseling. You are also ordered to pay restitution for the damages caused by your actions.

With the sentence pronounced, you're taken into custody and transported to a nearby prison. As you enter the facility, the weight of the consequences of your actions sinks in. You're determined to make the most of your time behind bars and turn your life around.

[INVENTORY]: Wallet (confiscated), keys (confiscated), smartphone (confiscated), Walmart name tag (confiscated)

You find yourself in your prison cell, sharing the small space with a cellmate. The environment is harsh and unforgiving, but you're determined to make the best of it.

What do you want to do?
